result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Slezak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $1,000.00 fine plus costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------

Pay DA Service fees in the amount of $385.00.
-------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
-------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes: with NO work release privileges to commence on or before December 22, 2016 @ 8:00 a.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas D Slezak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas D Slezak in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing argument and recommendation by DDA Johnson. Defendant's wife makes a statement to the Court. Defendant's friend, B.B. and brother also speak on behalf of the defendant. Argument by Atty. Steen. Defendant makes a statement to the Court. Minutes filed.
Sentencing hearing on October 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

BAILIFFS:  GEORGE CLETTENBERG AND JOHN GORDON
Defendant Nicholas D Slezak in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 8:50 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for trial. Court makes a record that Atty. Steen did not object to the State's Motions in Limine. Atty. Steen confirms Court's record. ADA Donohoo makes a record as to her witness and makes a motion that her witness be instructed as to what he can and cannot stay. ADA Donohoo makes a record as to video. Atty. Steen request that witnesses be excluded. Discussion as to witnesses. ADA Donohoo informs the Court that  Intern John Rafa Todd will be conducting the majority of the trial.
OFF THE RECORD CLERK TAKES ATTENDANCE, GIVES OATH TO JURY, AND SEATS THE FIRST 23 IN THE BOX FOR VOIR DIRE.
9:19 a.m. - Court in session with first 23 in the box. Appearances made. Court addresses jury and explains the charges/penalties and informs the as to process of jury selection. State introduces themselves and their witnesses. Atty. Steen introduces himself and the defendant.
9:23 a.m. - Voir dire by the Court
9:30 a.m. - Voir dire by ADA Raffa Todd
10:00 a.m. - Voir dire by Attorney Steen
10:10 a.m. - Court goes off the record while parties take their strikes. 
10:18 a.m. - Clerk swears panel and Court excuses remaining jurors. Court reads short instruction (#50) to the panel. 
Court excuses panel and is in recess @ 10:22 a.m. for morning break.
Court back in session @ 10:42 a.m. Jury seated in jury box. Court reads preliminary instructions to the jury.
10:44 a.m. - Opening Statement by Atty Rafa Todd. Atty. Steen waives his right to opening statement until the close of the State's case.
10:51 a.m. - State calls Keith Romanek who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo. Exhibit #1 (DVD) identified by ADA Donohoo who requests that exhibit be admitted into evidence and published to the jury. No objection by Atty. Steen. DVD played for the jury. Witness responds to ADA Donohoo's questions regarding DVD. Exhibits #4 and #5 (previously marked), identified and testified to by the witness. State moves exhibit #4 & 5 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received. Exhibits # 6 through #9 (previously marked) identified and testified to by the witness. State moves exhibits into evidence.  No objection. Exhibits received. Direct exam continues.
11:12 a.m. - Cross exam by Atty. Steen. Exhibits #10 & #11 (previously marked) identified and testified to by the witness. Atty. Steen moves exhibits into evidence. No objection. exhibits received. Exhibit #13 (previously marked) identified and testified to by the witness, who also demonstrates helmet/field of vision. Atty. Steen moves exhibit #13 into evidence. No objection by ADA Donohoo. Exhibit received. Exhibit #12 (previously marked) identified and testified to by the witness. Atty. Steen moves Exhibit #12 into evidence and requests to publish to the jury. Objection by ADA Donohoo as exhibit #13 is not a direct replica of bike in question. Argument. Response by the Court. Exhibit is not received at this time. Atty. Steen reserves his right to bring matter up again. Cross exam continues.
11:33 a.m. - Redirect by ADA Donohoo
Witness excused @ 11:34 a.m.
11:34 a.m. - State calls Deputy William Krueger who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of Intern Rafa Todd.
11:44 a.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Steen
No redirect. Witness excused.
11:46 a.m. - State calls Donna Brillhart who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of Intern Rafa Todd.
No cross exam. Witness excused.
11:50 a.m. - State calls Jennifer Woodridge who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of Intern Rafa Todd
No cross exam. Witness excused.
Court in recess @ 11:52 a.m. for lunch.
1:16 p.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. ADA Donohoo makes a record regarding her objection to certain testimony of officer. 
1:21 p.m. - Jury seated in jury box. State calls Officer Derrick Goetsch who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of Intern Rafa Todd. Exhibit #2 (previously marked) identified and testified to by the witness. Exhibit #3 (previously marked) identified and testified to by the witness. State moves exhibits 2 & 3 into evidence and publication. No objection. Exhibits received and published to the jury.
1:30 p.m. - Cross exam by Atty. Steen
1:33 p.m. - Redirect by Intern Rafa Todd
No recross. Witness excused. State rests.
Court excuses jury for brief recess to discuss defense witnesses. Atty. Steen and defendant excused to discuss testimony of defendant.
1:40 p.m. Back in session outside the presence of the jury. Atty. Steen informs the Court that the defendant will not testify. Court has colloquy with the defendant regarding his rights with respect to testifying. Defendant and Atty. Steen responds to Court's questions. Court finds decision not to testify is one that is freely and knowingly. Defense has no other witnesses and therefore rests.
1:45 p.m. - Court addresses jury instruction packet with the parties. Parties agree to instructions as stated by the Court.
1:50 p.m. - Jury seated in jury box. Court makes a record as to agreement on jury instruction. Atty. Steen rests. Court excuses alternate juror. Court reads jury instructions.
2:04 p.m. - Closing argument by Intern Rafa Todd
2:11 p.m. - Closing argument by Atty. Steen
2:23 p.m. - Rebuttal by Intern Rafa Todd
2:26 p.m. - Court reads final instruction.
2:29 p.m. - Clerk swears the Bailiffs; Court hands instructions and verdict to the Bailiff; Jury released for deliberations.
Court in recess @ 2:31 p.m.
2:39 p.m. - Court back in session with Jury Question to view video. No objection by either party. Jury watches video. Court in recess
2:51 p.m. - Jury has reached a verdict. Jury seated in jury box. Court addresses foreman and reads verdict. Jury finds the defendant guilty of count #1. Parties do not wish the jury polled. Court reads final instructions. Jury excused at 2:54 p.m.
State moves for judgment on the verdict. Atty. Steen has no motions. Court enters judgment on the verdicts and turns to parties as to sentencing. Atty. Steen requests matter be set out for sentencing. Neither party requests PSI. Court in recess @ 3:00 p.m.



  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas D Slezak in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties confirm for trial. ADA Donohoo makes a record as to Motions in Limine filed today, jury instructions, witnesses. Defense does not the Motions in Limine as filed. Parties to be ready to go at 8:45 a.m.

Defendant Nicholas D Slezak in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Application for Extradition of Keith A. Romanek as an Out-of-State Witness in a Criminal Case
Certificate of Necessity and Materiality for the Appearance of Keith A. Romanek as an Out-of-State Witness

Defendant Nicholas D Slezak in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 03-14-16. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas D Slezak in court with attorney Larry D. Steen.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Motion deadline 10-22-15. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas D Slezak in court with attorney Larry D. Steen.   Atty Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
